intro: Polyosma coriacea, commonly known as the rough-stemmed polyosma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pinkish flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
